Summary: Email One-Time Code for Password Reset
Description: Implement a feature allowing users to reset their password using a one-time code sent via email.
AcceptanceCriteria:
User receives a one-time code via email upon requesting a password reset.
The one-time code expires in 10 minutes.
User can reset their password using a valid one-time code.

Description: Develop test cases for verifying the OTP functionality during password reset.
AcceptanceCriteria:
Positive test case: User successfully resets password with a valid OTP.
Negative test case: User fails to reset password with an expired OTP.
Negative test case: User fails to reset password with an invalid OTP.

Summary: Rate Limiting for Password Reset Attempts
Description: Implement rate limiting to restrict the number of password reset attempts per user.
AcceptanceCriteria:
User can attempt password reset a maximum of 3 times per hour.
User receives a notification after exceeding the maximum number of attempts.
Further attempts are blocked until the rate limit resets.

Summary: Audit Event for Successful Password Reset
Description: Log an audit event whenever a user successfully resets their password.
AcceptanceCriteria:
An audit event is generated upon successful password reset.
The audit event includes the user's ID and timestamp of the reset.
The audit event is accessible in the system logs.

Summary: Regression Testing for Existing Login Flow
Description: Conduct regression testing to ensure the existing login flow is not affected by the new password reset feature.
AcceptanceCriteria:
Existing login functionality remains unchanged.
No new errors are introduced in the login process.
All existing login test cases pass successfully.
